verb.description: Carry out or put into effect (a plan, order, or course of action)
examples: the corporation executed a series of financial deals

verb.description: Carry out a sentence of death on (a legally condemned person)
examples: he was convicted of treason and executed
synonyms: carry out a sentence of death on

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French executer, from medieval Latin executare, from Latin exsequi follow up, punish, from ex- out + sequi follow.
